feature.name: Benkabou2018
Mean Absolute Error
feature.description: Mean Absolute Error (MAE) Measures average/mean squared error of our predictions. MAE = \Sigma_{i=1}^{n}\frac{|\hat{y}_i - y_i|}{n} Gives less weight to the outliers, when you are sure that they are outliers prefer MAE to MSE.

feature.name: Mean Square Error
feature.description: Mean Squared Error (MSE) Incorporates both the variance and the bias of the predictor. MSE = \Sigma_{i=1}^{n}{\frac{(\hat{y_i} - y_i)^2}{n}} When you have unexpected values that you should take into account use MSE instead of MAE.
